name: procession
content:

C2 [ C ] a line of people who are all walking or travelling in the same direction, especially in a formal way as part of a religious ceremony or public celebration: a wedding/funeral procession The festival will open with a procession led by the mayor.
[ S ] a series of people or things, one after the other: My day has just been a never-ending procession of visitors.
More examplesFewer examplesThe dancers leading the procession were in colourful and elaborate costumes.He craned forward to see the procession.Huge crowds followed the funeral procession in a public demonstration of grief.The Queen's carriage headed the procession.Thousands of people lined the streets to watch the presidential procession pass by.
